trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The abyssal luminous eel can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every six hours to avoid suffocation.

trait.name: Static Shock
entries: An abyssal luminous eel's body generates a potent charge of lightning. A creature that touches or makes a successful melee attack against the abyssal luminous eel takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Storm Glide
entries: During storms, the abyssal luminous eel can travel through the air as if under the effects of a {@spell fly} spell, except using its swim speed.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the abyssal luminous eel has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: As a bonus action, the abyssal luminous eel sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10 ft. This effect persists until the eel ends it with a bonus action.

trait.name: Abyssal Camouflage
entries: The abyssal luminous eel has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in the dark.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abyssal luminous eel makes one bite attack and one tail slap attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is immune to lightning damage, it can't be {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage and the target is pushed up to 10 feet away if it is a creature.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The abyssal luminous eel exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each target in that line takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) lightning damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Flash {@recharge}
entries: The abyssal luminous eel flashes its bio-luminescent organs in a blinding display of light in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

bonus.name: Lure
entries: While hidden or obscured by darkness, the abyssal luminous eel can use the lure on its head to create a series of mesmerizing flashes of light. Any creature that can see the lure must make make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute by the eel or until the eel harms the creature. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature may only use its turn to move towards the lure.

When a luminous eel survives past its average lifespan, it continues to grow until it becomes the leviathan-like creature that is the abyssal luminous eel. Swift, powerful, and massive, abyssal luminous eels conduct electricity like air elementals. So great are they at commanding the powers of electricity that they can even soar through the air when storm clouds gather in the sky, reversing their own electromagnetism to fly like dragons.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The alchemical skunk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The alchemical skunk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alchemical skunk uses its Alchemical Spray. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Alchemical Spray
entries: The alchemical skunk raises its tail and sprays an alchemical mixture. The skunk is immune to its own spray effects and to the spray effects of other alchemical skunks. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine the skunk's spray.

items.name: Pleasant Mist.
items.entry: The skunk produces a rosy mist. Each creature within 10 feet of the skunk must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Shrinking Cloud.
items.entry: The skunk releases a yellow gas. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be reduced as if targeted by the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Laughing Gas.
items.entry: The skunk emits a sparkling orange cloud. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} as it laughs for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Blinding Spray.
items.entry: The skunk shoots a stream of a green fluid. Each creature in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute, or until the creature uses an action to wipe its eyes.

items.name: Sleeping Fog.
items.entry: The skunk sprays a sweet-smelling blue fog. Each creature within 10 feet of the skunk must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

items.name: Poison Fog.
items.entry: The skunk excretes a foul-smelling purple fog around itself until the start of its next turn. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the skunk must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

entries: The large skunk waddles forward, sniffing at a spilled potion. As a sound nearby startles it, the skunk raises its tail, and the stripes on its back change color.

entries.name: Magical Prank
entries: The unfortunate result of a magic school prank, alchemical skunks were created when an ordinary skunk was forced to drink a combination of potions. Despite their larger size, alchemical skunks still look and act like ordinary skunks, except for the ever-changing color of the stripes on their backs. Experienced foresters know that the colors on the alchemical skunk's back indicate which magical malady the creature is about to spray and do their best to avoid aggravating these dangerous creatures.

entries.name: Laboratory Pests
entries: Alchemical skunks forage the same as their nonmagical kin, but they are also regularly found scavenging the waste of alchemical laboratories. They enjoy feasting on potions and potion components, much to the dismay of alchemists and adventurers alike.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The anophiloi has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The anophiloi can pinpoint, by scent, the location of living creatures within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The anophiloi makes two attacks. one with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the anophiloi attaches to it. While attached, the anophiloi doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the anophiloi's turns, the target loses 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) hp due to blood loss.

The anophiloi can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 20 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the anophiloi by succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength check.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.
{@i With a needle-like snout and a gut full of blood, the anophiloi are hard to miss. The buzz of the creature's wings haunts the jungles and marshes, sending warm‑blooded creatures for cover.}

entries.name: Blood Drinkers
entries: Predators of the swamplands, jungles, and other humid places, the anophiloi, intelligent mosquitoes the size of large dogs, feed mainly on livestock and large game animals. Their choice of food, however, is a pragmatic one and has nothing to do with morality; game animals won't organize to wipe them out, humanoids will. When famished, anything that bleeds becomes prey for the anophiloi.

entries.name: Seasonal Menace
entries: The anophiloi require heat and humidity to thrive. They spend the cold months of the year dwindling in size and dehydrating while hidden in hibernation after one last gluttonous feeding. By the end of this dormant period, the creatures resemble a bundle of gray and black sticks. As soon as the temperature increases, the anophiloi take to the air and seek out easy prey.

entries.name: Barely Kept in Check
entries: The anophiloi's period of dormancy allows farmers and keepers of livestock to keep the creature's population thin. At the first dip in temperature, hunts are organized. If not for the frenetic pace and frequency of their egg laying, the anophiloi would be an unpleasant memory in settled regions.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The anzu has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The anzu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The anzu's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The anzu doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The anzu uses its Lightning Relocation. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its talons.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The anzu uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Fire Breath.
items.entry: The anzu exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Water Breath.
items.entry: The anzu exhales a wave of water in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 38 ({@damage 11d6}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 30 feet away from the anzu and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Lightning Relocation
entries: The anzu teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When it does, it briefly transforms into a bolt of lightning, flashes upwards, then crashes down unharmed at its destination. Each creature within 5 feet of the anzu's starting location or destination must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature within 5 feet of both locations makes this saving throw only once.
A giant macaw roars out its fury in spouts of fire and scalding water while lightning crackles through its feathers.

entries.name: Territorial
entries: Anzu are fierce and territorial predators, claiming ranges along the edges of deserts, wide grasslands, or high mountains. Extremely long-lived, they mate for life, producing two or three eggs every decade.

entries.name: Elemental Birthright
entries: Offspring of a wind god or primordial wind spirit, anzu are the personification of the south wind, lightning, and the driving monsoon. Uniquely tied to the elements of fire, water, and wind, they react poorly to weather altering magic.

trait.name: Arcane Discharge
entries: When an arcanaphage dies, it explodes in a surge of partially-digested magical energy. Each creature within 5 feet per Feed score must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage per Feed score on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For 1 minute afterward, the affected area is awash with volatile magic. A creature that starts its turn in the affected area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

trait.name: Hunger
entries: Each time it feeds in combat, it regains hp equal to twice the level of the spell it ate and increases its Feed score by 1. The arcanaphage can't have a Feed score higher than 8, and its Feed score reduces by 1 each time it finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Ingest Magic
entries: At the start of each of the arcanaphage's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it that is currently maintaining concentration on a spell must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell ends and the arcanaphage feeds.

trait.name: Magic Immunity
entries: The arcanaphage is immune to damage from spells. It has advantage on saving throws against all other magical effects.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The arcanaphage can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcanaphage makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Arcane Beam
entries: The arcanaphage fires a powerful beam of arcane energy at one creature within 60 feet of it that it can see. The arcanaphage expends its stored magic, depleting its Feed score by 1. On a hit, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. The arcanaphage can expend an additional Feed point to increase this damage by 4 ({@damage 1d6}), to a maximum of 7 points.

If the arcanaphage expends up to 4 Feed points in a single turn, the target must roll on the Wild Magic table, treating itself as the target. If the arcanaphage expends up to 8 Feed points in a single turn, the arcanaphage can choose what magical effect the creature is afflicted with.

action.name: Devour Arcana {@recharge 5}
entries: The arcanaphage's outstretched tentacles glow a sudden and bright pink as it feeds on the arcane. The arcanaphage chooses one creature, object, or magical effect within 30 feet of it, devouring the effect. This action works like the dispel magic spell, except the arcanaphage must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell level. Its ability check for this is +6. If it successfully dispels the spell, the arcanaphage feeds.

reaction.name: Voracious
entries: The arcanaphage's tentacles glow when a spell is cast within 30 feet of it, countering the spell. This reaction works like the counterspell spell, except the arcanaphage must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell level. Its ability check for this is +6. If it successfully counters the spell, the arcanaphage feeds.
{@i A soft-bodied, iridescent creature floats by, tentacles rippling along its back as it quests for its next meal.}
Arcanaphage are commonly found in places imbued with magic, their colorful skin rhythmically pulsating as they graze on arcane energies.

entries.name: Magivore
entries: The arcanaphage's  diet consists almost exclusively of magic, though it consumes on zooplankton as well. This sea slug has no mouth; it feeds by absorbing nearby magical energy into a series of ropy tentacles that run the length of its body. With enough time, an arcanaphage can slowly slurp all of the power out of magical objects, traps, or spells permanently imbuing an area. Most arcanaphage are about the size of a large dog, though especially well-fed specimens the size of draft horses have been reported.

entries.name: Docile Unless Angered
entries: If left to feed undisturbed, an arcanaphage typically ignores its surroundings. However, when it feels threatened or when food is scarce and it senses magic nearby, it viciously attacks.

entries.name: Unwitting Guardians
entries: Its ability to neutralize magic in its immediate area, combined with its calm demeanor, makes an arcanaphage an excellent guardian against a wizard's ire. Some warlords even bring pet arcanaphage to battle as protection from spellcasters, although this is a gamble since the creatures like to sit on and absorb power from unattended magical objects, like a warlord's heirloom weapon, and can release a torrent of magical energy when slain.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Avatar of Kama'hu fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Gift of the Chromatic Dragon
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu has manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, gaining the following benefits:

- As a bonus action, the Avatar of Kama'hu can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits. After the Avatar of Kama'hu uses this ability, it  can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

- When the Avatar of Kama'hu takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, it can use its reaction to grant itself resistance to that instance of damage. It can use this reaction a number of times equal to its proficiency bonus, and it regains all expended uses on a long rest

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When the Avatar of Kama'hu uses the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost it extra movement on that turn. Additionally, when the Avatar of Kama'hu makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hits or not.

trait.name: Hungry Jaws (1/Rest)
entries: In battle, the Avatar of Kama'hu can throw itself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, the Avatar of Kama'hu can make a special attack with its bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and the Avatar gains 7 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Kama'hu's Gift
entries: The creature that transforms into the Avatar of Kama'hu can use a bonus action to expend one of its spell slots to regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes four attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Avatar cannot bite another target. If the creature remains {@condition grappled} by the Avatar's bite, it may perform subsequent bite attacks without having to roll an attack roll against the creature.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the Avatar of Kama'hu's choice that is within 120 feet of the Avatar and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Avatar of Kama'hu's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Atomic Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 18d6}) fire damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Avatar makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The Avatar makes an attack with its tail.

legendary.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Avatar of Kama'hu emits a devastating roar. Creatures of the Avatar's choice within 120 feet of it and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful save. Additionally, creatures who fail the save are {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Explosive Scales
entries: The bazelgeuse's scales, when dislodged from its body, act as time bombs. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties), all scales explode, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to all creatures within 5 feet of them.

trait.name: Shed
entries: Whenever the bazelguese makes a melee weapon attack, it dislodges an explosive scale which lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its location.

trait.name: Carpet Bomb
entries: For every 20 feet the bazelgeuse flies, it dislodges an explosive scale which lands in an unoccupied space directly below it.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 56 hit points or fewer, the bazelgeuse enters a "super-heated" state, gaining advantage on attack rolls. In addition, Explosive Scales detonate at the end of the bazelgeuse's turn.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the bazelgeuse is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a headbutt attack, the attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage to the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bazelgeuse makes three attacks; one headbutt attack, one tail attack, and one wing attack.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The bazelgeuse exhales fire in a 45-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 46 ({@damage 7d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@i Hurtling through the dense jungle, a large tyrannosaur crashes to the forest floor. Scrambling to its feet, the jagged scales embedded in its hide begin to flash red as a winged predator leaps towards the startled dinosaur. As the creature’s talons make contact with the tyrannosaur’s flesh, the scales erupt, enveloping both animals in a violent explosion.}

{@b Armored Flesh.} Soaring above plateaus, grasslands, and wherever else they may find prey, the bazelgeuse is a large, wyvern-like beast covered in thick, bumpy scales with a bronze sheen. These scales are backed by a protective layer of identical scales, forming an impenetrable shield of keratin.

{@b B-72 Bomber.} The bazelgeuse's most distinctive feature is its ability to shed its scales, which act like timed bombs. These explosive scales are composed by the solidification of carbon, oxygen, and nitrogen, forming a dense, destructive fragment of keratin. Once dislodged, these scales detonate after a time, in a manner similar to a mine. However, when the beast enters its "super-heated" state, the scales detonate almost immediately. A bazalgeuse will use its enormous body to overwhelm foes and the combustive power of its scales to scorch them when battling up-close. They prefer to fight in the air. shedding their explosive scales over a wide area in a manner so they can prey on whatever gets caught in the blast, like explosive vultures.

{@b Thrilled Combatant.} Nomadic hunters, bazelgeuse easily assert themselves as apex predators in whatever environment they pass through, disrupting the local food chain. They will violently brawl other large predators without hesitation, even diving into fights that don’t seem to involve them in the slightest. With an insatiable lust for combat, these beasts will attack other creatures regardless of their size but seem to gravitate towards other apex species, such as dragons, wyverns, and large dinosaurs.

trait.name: Collective Mind
entries: The benign colossus' individual metastatics are collected via a hive mind. It can telepathically communicate with any of its individual metastatics within 50 miles of it, and it can't be surprised.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The benign colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Swarm Form
entries: A benign colossus can use its bonus action to split into four individual swarms of tiny cancerous organisms called metastatics. Each swarm is Large and has a hit point total equal to the benign colossus' hit points divided by 4 (rounded down), and all are affected by any conditions, spells, and other magical effects that affected the benign colossus. The swarms act on the same initiative count as the benign colossus did and occupy any unoccupied space that previously contained the benign colossus. A metastatic swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing. A swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

As an action, the swarms can reform into a single bone colossus as long as all surviving swarms are within 5 feet of each other. The reformed bone colossus' hp total is equal to the combined remaining hp of the swarms, and the bone colossus is affected by any conditions, spells, and other magical effects currently affecting any of the swarms. It occupies any unoccupied space that previously contained at least one of the swarms that formed it.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The benign colossus regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The benign colossus makes two  attacks.

action.name: Cancerous Claw (Colossus Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Razor Teeth (Swarm Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the black quoxxarie moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its ram on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The black quoxxarie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The black quoxxarie's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Aura of Withering
entries: Provided the black quoxxarie isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, any creature hostile to the quoxxarie within 30 feet of one or more black quoxxaries withers. If the creature takes damage, it takes an extra 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. Plant creatures take an extra 5 (2d4) necrotic damage instead. The first time an affected creature takes damage in the aura while at half its hit points or fewer, the creature feels horrid thirst and hunger and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If such a creature drops to 0 hit points in the aura, it gains another level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can gain only two levels of {@condition exhaustion} from any Aura of Withering in 24 hours. This aura also kills tiny inanimate, nonmagical plants in its area and damages larger plants, eventually killing them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black quoxxarie makes one ram attack and one hooves attack.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Get the Horns
entries: If the black quoxxarie takes damage from one creature within 40 feet of it, the quoxxarie can take the Disengage action and move up to half its speed toward that creature. If the creature is then within reach, the quoxxarie can make a ram attack against it with advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the blazehorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Firebomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The blazehorn launches a ball of flaming tar at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and ignites. If the save is successful, the target takes half as much fire damage and doesn't catch fire. An ignited created takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to douse the flames, ending the effect. Flammable objects in the area also catch fire.

reaction.name: Defensive Launch
entries: When the blazehorn drops to fewer than half its hit points, it recharges Firebomb and uses it immediately. It targets the source of the damage that triggered this reaction if possible.
{@i “I’m sure some alchemist’s to blame for this.”}

{@b Flame Throwers.} Blazehorns are hulking, hoofed mammals whose bodies produce a substance like alchemist’s fire. A blazehorn can launch this volatile material from a hump on its back. With an unending supply of fire, blazehorns love spreading destruction. Their young thrive in burned areas, feeding on scorched plant material, burnt resinous trees, and ash.

{@b Destruction Untamed.} Numerous alchemists have sought to tame blazehorns to simplify the creation of their volatile elixirs. Every attempt has ended in failure. The fiery nature of a blazehorn has proven impossible to curb for long.

trait.name: Stable
entries: Whenever an effect knocks the bombarder beetle {@condition prone}, it can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} beetle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

trait.name: Thermal
entries: The bombarder beetle can sense the heat radiating off of a creature. It can't be surprised by something that gives off heat.

trait.name: Combustive
entries: If the bombarder beetle takes fire damage and its barrage is recharged, all of its rods violently combust. Each creature within 120 feet of the bombarder beetle when its rods explode must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 65 ({@damage 10d12}) fire damage and 65 ({@damage 10d12}) thunder damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature caught in the blast must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be thrown 20 feet away from the blast and knocked {@condition prone}. This blast deals double damage to structures and objects. After exploding, the bombarder beetle can't use its explosive rods or barrage for one hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bombarder beetle fires two explosive rods.

action.name: Pike Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Explosive Rod
entries: The bombarder beetle chooses a point within 300 feet of it. Each target within 30 feet of that location must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Any creature caught in the blast must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be thrown 10 feet away from the blast and knocked {@condition prone}. This attack deals double damage to structures and objects.

action.name: Barrage (Recharge One Hour)
entries: The bombarder beetle launches an intense barrage at a line within 600 feet of it. The line is 120 feet long and 15 feet wide. Each creature within 30 feet of the line must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take ({@damage 7d12}) fire damage and ({@damage 7d12}) thunder damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Any creature caught in the blast must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be thrown 20 feet away from the blast and knocked {@condition prone}. This attack deals double damage to structures and objects. After using this attack, the bombarder beetle can't use its explosive rod attack until its barrage recharges.

{@i Steadying itself with its six legs, the sturdy insect took aim, directing itself towards the aggressive predator that prowled ahead. With a sharp hiss, a long, smoking rod shot from the beetle’s wing, striking the carnivore directly in the thigh, enveloping it in a violent flash of fire and pain.}
A distant relative to robust and bulky beetles, the bombarder beetle is an insect that wages incredible destruction on whatever unfortunate soul provokes it.

{@b Chemical Destruction.} The bombarder beetle is an innovator in the field of organic destruction. Hidden under the elytra of its now vestigial wings, the bombarder beetle houses several long, hollow rods filled with methane, nitroglycerine, and various pyrophoric materials. As its main form of defense, the bombarder beetle can launch these rods at high speeds. As these rods collide with a target, they break open, causing the rod to ignite before spontaneously combusting into a violent explosion.

{@b Barrage Bugs.} Bombarder beetles are commonly referred to as “barrage bugs” for their use on the battlefield. Bombarder beetles are difficult to train as beasts of war due to their nervous dispositions and odd dietary habits. Alongside the likes of leafy greens, bombarder beetles commonly seek out oil to consume and internally refine. They then use that internalized oil to create volatile natural gases and rudimentary jet fuel. As oil can be costly to supply, it takes a great deal of wealth to raise and train a bombarder beetle for battle, though doing so is often worth it. The presence of a bombarder beetle can often sway the tide of a battle in one’s favor very quickly.

trait.name: Bony Body
entries: A creature that starts its turn or enters the space within 5 feet of the bonespitter must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The bonespitter can hold its breath for 6 hours.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The bonespitter can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 30-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bonespitter makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its bone spike.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the bonespitter. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the bonespitter, and it takes 17 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the bonespitter's turns. An undead creature made of mostly bones, such as a {@creature skeleton}, is immune to this acid damage.

If the bonespitter takes 45 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the bonespitter must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the bonespitter. If the bonespitter dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bone Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +13} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked {@condition prone}, pinned to the ground by the spike, and {@condition restrained}. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature or a creature within 5 feet of it can make a {@dc 22} Strength check, removing the spike and ending the condition on a success. The spike can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 15; hp 25; vulnerability to bludgeoning damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage).

action.name: Shard Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The bonespitter exhales a 90-foot cone of bone shards. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d12}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If a creature fails this saving throw, it is also knocked {@condition prone}, pinned to the ground by a shard, and {@condition restrained}. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature or a creature within 5 feet of it can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, removing the shard and ending the condition on a success. The shard can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 15; hp 22; vulnerability to bludgeoning damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage).
A massive worm bursts through the ground, its body covered in bony protrusions.
Bonespitters are bone-covered predators that live in the soft soil of grassy plains.

entries.name: Bones of Victims
entries: Bonespitters have unique digestive systems. When a bonespitter consumes another creature, the acid in the worm's stomach dissolves all of the prey's tissue and leaves only bones behind. The bones become part of the bonespitter's defenses, poking through its skin like sharp hair follicles. Other bones are stored in muscular sacks in the bonespitter's mouth, waiting to be unleashed on unsuspecting prey.

trait.name: Bombing Run
entries: For every 20 feet the brute bazelgeuse moves, it dislodges an explosive scale which lands in a space right next to it.

trait.name: Explosive Scales
entries: The brute bazelgeuse's scales, when dislodged from its body, act as time bombs. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties), all scales explode, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to all creatures within 5 feet of them.

trait.name: Shed
entries: Whenever the brute bazelguese makes a melee weapon attack, it dislodges an explosive scale which lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its location.

trait.name: Wounded Frenzy
entries: While it has half hit points or fewer, the brachydios gains the following benefits:

items: The brute bazelgeuse has advantage on all attack rolls.
The brute bazelgeuse’s Explosive Scales grow in size, increasing their explosion radius by 5 feet and dealing an extra 1d6 fire damage.
Explosive Scales now detonate at the end of the brute bazelgeuse’s turn.
The brute bazelgeuse cannot be {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition poisoned}.
The brute bazelgeuse deals an additional die of damage whenever it deals fire or thunder damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brute brachydios makes one bite attack and two attacks with its fists.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Bull Rush {@recharge 5}
entries: The brute bazelgeuse breaks into a reckless charge and moves up to its speed. During this move, the brute bazelgeuse may move through the spaces of other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the brute bazelgeuse moves through must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the target takes half as much bludgeoning and fire damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}, though it is shunted 5 feet away from the brute bazelgeuse in a random direction.

action.name: Chemical Reaction {@recharge 6}
entries: The brute bazelgeuse slams its fists into the ground and causes a chain of explosions in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) fire damage and 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage and being thrown 15 feet away in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful one, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't thrown in any direction.

action.name: Blazing Spores (2/Day)
entries: The brute bazeleguse exhales a blazing cloud of superheated spores in a 60-foot-cone. All creatures in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 46 ({@damage 7d12}) and falling {@condition unconscious} for ({@dice 1d4}) rounds or until the sleeper takes damage or someone uses an action to shake the creature awake. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much fire damage and isn’t made {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The buffalo deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sturdy
entries: When the buffalo fails a Constitution saving throw that deals damage, it takes only half damage. On a success, it takes no damage.

trait.name: Trample
entries: When the buffalo takes the Dash action, it can move through the space of a Medium or smaller creature, treating the creature's space as difficult terrain. As it moves through the creature's space, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target negates these effects.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage,
A hulking bovine of immense strength, the buffalo is a sturdy grazer that resides within expansive plains. Buffalo travel in colossal herds ranging in 10,000's of individuals.

trait.name: Gem Illumination
entries: As a bonus action, the carbuncle can cause its garnet to glow or not. While glowing, the garnet sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The carbuncle has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The carbuncle makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The carbuncle shoots a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of scintillating light from the garnet on its forehead. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i A glint of brilliant light shines from the forehead of a lithe cat-like creature covered in the vibrant plumage of a tropical songbird.}

The carbuncle is a jungle-dwelling beast highly sought after by alchemists for the shining jewel embedded in its forehead. The carbuncle's body is not unlike an ocelot mixed with a bird of paradise; a lithe, four-legged quadruped with vibrant purple‑and-crimson plumage instead of fur. Despite their bestial appearance, carbuncles possess great cunning and build villages of their own in caves deep in the jungle.

entries.name: Bearers of Precious Gems
entries: The glimmering garnet in this creature's forehead—the carbuncle for which it is named—is more than just a precious stone. Alchemists and other arcanists spend exorbitant amounts on carbuncle hunters because the gem is rumored to hold the power to amplify magic like light through a magnifying lens. What few wizards understand is that the carbuncle's garnet only holds magical power if given willingly; a garnet pried from the skull of a slain carbuncle still shines beautifully (and is worth 300 gp in most markets) but is devoid of magic. If a carbuncle willingly removes the gem from its forehead and gives it to another creature, the gem regrows in {@dice 1d4} weeks.

entries.name: Capricious Tricksters
entries: Carbuncles are well aware of how much their precious gem is valued by humans and their ilk and rightly fear humanoids for their cruelty and greed. However, particularly courageous carbuncles fight back against the hunters. They are not large or powerful creatures and instead use their cunning mind to trick hunters into following them into pits of quicksand, the lairs of deadlier creatures, or into piranhainfested waters.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The carrion has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The carrion can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The carrion can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The carrion can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Effective Form
entries: Any damage the carrion would take is reduced to 0. It has advantage on ability checks and saving throws.

action.name: Dealing with the Carrion
entries: The carrion cannot be overcome or killed by combat. Any weapon attack against it that hits AC 12 makes contact but deals no lasting damage. However, if the attack would deal 10 or more damage, the carrion has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn. If the carrion would take 10 or more damage from spells or other effects, it yields the same result. Spells that impose conditions function normally against the carrion, but those conditions end automatically at the end of its next turn.

The carrion is a being of flesh given form, an entity of writhing skin, teeth, and bone. The creature is supernaturally swift, swirling tendrils of sharpened bone at anything within reach. Fortunately, the creature is roughly as intelligent as an ooze.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The cerebrae's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.

trait.name: Psychic Immutability
entries: The cerebrae is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Psychic Defense
entries: The cerebrae adds its Intelligence modifier to its AC. If the cerebrae takes force or necrotic damage from an attack, this trat doesn't function until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Psychic
entries: The cerebrae subjects up to four creatures within 120 feet of it that it can see to a mild psychic attack. A targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.

action.name: Psystrike {@recharge 5}
entries: The cerebrae targets a single creature it can see within 120 feet of it, attacking them with a powerful psychic assault. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw, taking 78 ({@damage 12d12}) psychic damage and becoming {@condition stunned} for 1 minute on a failed save or half as much damage and not becoming {@condition stunned} on a successful one. An affected creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Recover {@recharge 6}
entries: As an action, the cerebrae makes a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw to psychically recharge its mind and regenerate its body. On a successful save, the cerebrae regains ({@dice 6d8 + 24}) hit points. On a failed save, it does not regain any hit points and this action is wasted.

reaction.name: Pressure
entries: If a creature within 120 feet of the cerebrae that it can see makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, the cerebrae can exert its absolute psychic pressure. When a creature is subjected to psychic pressure, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw, rerolling with disadvantage on a failed save.

trait.name: Controller
entries: The cheetah can use a bonus action to make a bite attack against a {@condition prone} or {@condition incapacitated} target within its reach.

trait.name: Blinding Speed (2/Short Rest)
entries: When the cheetah takes the Dash action it can move at 2 times its speed (120 ft.) during this movement. Additionally, if the cheetah succeeds on a {@dc 10} Constitution check at the end of its turn, its ability to use Blinding Speed recharges.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The cheetah has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Feline Agility
entries: The cheetah takes the Dash action.

The cheetah is a relatively medium, light cat that resides in savannas and rolling hills. It is the fastest land animal and can reach speeds of nearly 110 miles per hour in short bursts. Cheetahs hunt during the day, chasing prey at high speeds before tackling them and dealing the finishing blow.

trait.name: Darkness Aura
entries: The chiropteran behemoth can use a bonus action to create darkness in a 40-foot radius centered on itself. This darkness moves with the behemoth. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this magical darkness, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it. A light-producing spell of 2nd level or lower is dispelled if its area overlaps the darkness’ area. This darkness lasts until the start of the behemoth’s next turn or until the behemoth dies.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The chiropteran behemoth doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chiropteran behemoth regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the behemoth is exposed to an undoing elixir, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the behemoth’s next turn. The behemoth dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The chiropteran behemoth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the chiropteran behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Potent Weapons
entries: The chiropteran behemoth’s weapon attacks are magical and they ignore any resistance to their damage types.

trait.name: Swoop
entries: If the chiropteran behemoth flies at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The chiropteran behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chiropteran behemoth makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the chiropteran behemoth has advantage on the attack roll against a creature, that target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces it to 0 hit points.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage. If the chiropteran behemoth scores a critical hit against a target, the target takes 48 ({@damage 12d6 + 6}) slashing damage. If a creature dies due to damage from such a critical hit, it’s head or another vital body part is severed or destroyed.

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 6}
entries: The chiropteran behemoth emits a shriek in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 7d12}) psychic damage and be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The chiropteran behemoth makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Swoop (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chiropteran behemoth moves up to half its speed and makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Wing Buffet (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chiropteran behemoth beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away from the behemoth. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature also falls {@condition prone}. The behemoth can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Chromaleon

trait.name: Active Adaptation
entries: The chromaleon has three states it can take. They are the dragon state, fire state, and the ice state. Each state provides benefits and detriments depending on which state it is in, as shown below:

The chromaleon begins combat in either the fire state or ice state. When it begins combat in the fire state, the order of the states it changes into is: fire, dragon, ice, dragon and then repeats. When it starts in the ice stage, the order is: ice, dragon, fire, dragon and then repeats.

items.name: Fire State
entries: While in the fire state, the chromaleon is immune to fire damage, but vulnerable to cold damage.

items.name: Dragon State
entries: While in the dragon state, the chromaleon is resistant to all damage except for necrotic, radiant, and psychic damage.

items.name: Ice State
entries: While in the ice state, the chromaleon is immune to cold damage, but vulnerable to fire damage.
Whenever the chromaleon’s hit points are reduced by 50 in its current active state, it changes its state to the next in the order and uses a reaction to use its element burst.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The chromaleon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Avatar of Elements
entries: The chromaleon's melee attacks deal an additional 9 ({@damage 3d6}) damage. This damage is chosen by the chromaleon when it attacks and can be acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

trait.name: Elemental Overload
entries: The chromaleon gains 1 charge for every 10 elemental damage (acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder) it takes from a single attack or spell. The charges reset to 0 after the chromaleon uses its Escaton Judgement.

trait.name: Legendary Limit
entries: The chromaleon can only use each legendary action once per round.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The chromaleon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The chromaleon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chromaleon makes three attacks; one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its gore.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the chromaleon. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the chromaleon, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the chromaleon’s turns.

If the chromaleon takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the chromaleon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the chromaleon. If the chromaleon dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition restrained}. Up to one Huge or larger target or two Large or smaller targets can be {@condition grappled} by chromaleon at a time.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Principal Annihilation {@recharge 6}
entries: A violent, destructive streak of chromatic energy erupts from the chromaleon’s maw in a 200 foot line that is 30 feet long. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d8 to determine what happens to it.
{@b 1 - Fire.}

The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 6 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
{@b 2 - Acid.}

The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target takes an additional 15 ({@damage 6d4}) acid damage at the beginning of its next turn.
{@b 3 - Lightning.}

The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target can use either an action or a bonus action on its next turn, but not both, and the target can’t use reactions. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
{@b 4 - Poison.}
The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target is then {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.
{@b 5 - Ice.}
The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target’s movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.
{@b 6 – Thunderblight.}

The target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target is then {@condition stunned} for 1 minute unless it is immune to thunder damage.
{@b 7 - Dragonblight.}

The target takes 118 ({@damage 12d12 + 40}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell. The beam automatically disintegrates any Large or smaller nonmagical objects or structures caught in it. If the target is a Huge or larger object or structure, the beam disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it.
{@b 8 - Special.}
The target receives full elemental wrath. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.

action.name: Escaton Judgement (1/Day)
entries: The chromaleon swoops down from the sky (without provoking opportunity attacks) if it is not already on the ground and begins gathering energy until the start of its next turn. While charging, the chromaleon is immune to the {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition paralyzed}, and {@condition unconscious} conditions.

On its next turn, the chromaleon uses its action to release the energy it has gathered in a 600-foot-radius-sphere around it. All nonmagical structures, objects, and terrain above ground level in that area are obliterated and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 210 ({@damage 60d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The amount of damage Escaton Judgement deals can be reduced by a number of d6’s equal to the number of charges collected by elemental overload.

reaction.name: Element Burst
entries: When the chromaleon activates its active adaptation, it can use its reaction to release elemental energy into the area around it. Each creature in a 30-foot radius-sphere around the chromaleon must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is determined by the active state the chromaleon changes into: fire damage for fire state, force damage for dragon state, and cold damage for ice state.

legendaryHeader: The chromaleon can take 3 legendary actions depending on which state it is currently in, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The chromaleon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The chromaleon moves up to its movement speed.

legendary.name: Arc Lightning
entries: The chromaleon magically causes lightning to strike within 120 feet of it along a 45-foot long line that is 5 feet wide. It then causes lightning to strike along another 45-foot long, 5-foot-wide line, but this line must begin in a space adjacent to the original lightning strike or pass through it at one point in the line. Each creature in a line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage. A creature in the area of more than one line makes the saving throw at disadvantage but does not take any additional damage.

legendary.name: Dragon State
entries: The chromaleon can use the following legendary actions while in the dragon state.

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The chromaleon uses its multiattack.

items.name: Dragon Rush
entries: The chromaleon moves up to half its flying speed in a straight line. During this movement, it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Each creature or object the chromaleon moves through must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

legendary.name: Fire State
entries: The chromaleon can use the following legendary actions while in the fire state.

items.name: Fireball
entries: The chromaleon exhales a fireball to a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Incineration
entries: The chromaleon exhales fire in a 120-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Scorched Earth
entries: The chromaleon rises 30 feet into the air without provoking opportunity attacks. It then exhales flames that blanket the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on a point directly below it. The ground continues to burn until the start of the chromaleon’s next turn. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on a turn takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage for every 5 feet it travels.

legendary.name: Ice State
entries: The chromaleon can use the following legendary actions while in the ice state.

items.name: Frost Breath
entries: The chromaleon rises 30 feet into the air without provoking opportunity attacks. It then exhales frost that blankets the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on a point directly below it. The frost remains until the start of the chromaleon’s next turn. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage for every 5 feet it travels.

items.name: Ice Shards
entries: The chromaleon freezes the air around it, creating ice shards that fill a 5-foot-cube in the air above each creature in a 90-foot radius around it. The shards plummet directly to the ground, forcing each creature in that area to make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage, is pushed 5 feet into an unoccupied space, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, is pushed 5 feet into an unoccupied space, but isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If there are no unoccupied spaces around the creature, it fails its saving throw and is knocked {@condition prone} under the ice chunk until it melts, is destroyed, or it succeeds on a {@dc 20} {@skill Athletics} check.

The ice shards remain in the spaces they land in until they melt at the start of the chromaleon’s next turn or are destroyed. The ice shards can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 10 hit points; vulnerable to fire damage; immune to cold, poison, and psychic damage). If the ice shard takes necrotic damage, it instead explodes in a 15-foot radius dealing 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage to each creature in that area.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chromatic behemoth's spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The chromatic behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The chromatic behemoth's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The chromatic behemoth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chromatic behemoth uses one of the options from Armed to the Teeth. It then makes one slam attack. It can not use the same option twice in a row.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Flesh-Crushing Stride
entries: The chromatic behemoth moves up to twice its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. During this move, it can enter a Large or smaller creatures' space. A creature whose space the chromatic behemoth enters must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the nearest space out of the chromatic behemoth’s path. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone} and takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage.

If the chromatic behemoth remains in the {@condition prone} creature's space, the creature is also {@condition restrained} until it's no longer in the same space as the chromatic behemoth. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the chromatic behemoth and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

If the chromatic behemoth collides with an object, structure, or creature during its movement that it can not share the same space with, the chromatic behemoth can make one slam attack against it. If the attack hits, the target takes the slam's damage and an additional 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage. If the target's hit points drop to 0, the chromatic behemoth can continue its movement, crumbling objects and structures beneath its power.

action.name: Armed to the Teeth
entries: The chromatic behemoth uses one of the following options:

items.name: Bonemelt Spray
items.entry: The chromatic behemoth spews acidic flame in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the saving throw are drenched in burning acid and take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the end of their turns. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to scrape off the burning tar.

items.name: Frigid Flail
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) cold damage. Up to three other creatures of the chromatic behemoth's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target must each make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area within 30 feet of the target becomes heavily obscured with snow until the end of the chromatic behemoth's next turn.

items.name: Volt Scream
items.entry: The chromatic behemoth targets a point within 120 feet of it that it can see. Each creature within 30 feet of that point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) lightning damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Toxic Crunch
items.entry: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: The Great Behemoth, of course, rimed in flame and frost, bellowed forth, colliding with the Earth and Man. Wicked lightning embellished its roars, shattering the heavens and smiting the gods. Hell followed in its wake.
The master of elements, the chromatic behemoth is a hulking, brutish predator that stalks the world’s badlands. Known by its earth-shattering roars, the chromatic behemoth is feared by many.

{@bold Nature’s Predator.} The chromatic behemoth is a very large, scaled carnivore with the physique of a cat-like crocodile. Flames, electricity, and acid radiate off of its scales, with crystals of ice extending from its heavy tail. The behemoth is capable of bending these elements to its will, accompanying its deadly attacks with potent displays of elemental destruction. The behemoth’s venomous bite and crushing bulk make it a dangerous and brutal predator, crushing and blazing through prey with ease.

{@bold Affectionate.} While mostly solitary in the wild, chromatic behemoths join together after the first five decades of their lifetimes to mate. Behemoths mate for life, travelling hundreds of miles to seek a partner. Chromatic behemoths can live to be hundreds of years old, though the first decade of a behemoth’s life is spent in the care of its parents. A young behemoth that is captured within the first three years of its life can be tamed with surprisingly little difficulty, as the behemoth takes to its trainer like a puppy would to an owner. Unfortunately for the trainer, the young behemoth is still rowdy, energetic, and capable of crumpling ogres with ease, making it very difficult to train. When properly instructed, a chromatic behemoth can be a steadfast and ferocious companion, forging powerful bonds with its owner.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until cured. While {@condition poisoned} this way, the target begins to degrade over the course of several hours until death or until the poison is cleansed. Every hour, the target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and has its hit point maximum reduced by that amount. Additionally, the target gains a level of {@condition exhaustion} every hour. After two hours, the target is {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

The King Cobra is an extremely dangerous terrestrial serpent, primarily preying on small mammals, birds, reptiles, and even other cobras. The cobra is widely regarded as one of the most deadly and iconic snakes, recognized by its prominent hood. Unlike most snakes, the cobra is extremely aggressive, and is responsible for the deaths of thousands every year.

While most know the stories of cobras killing elephants by sinking their long fangs into the soft tips of the elephant's trunk, not many know of the tale of a mere cobra that defended its nest from a tyrannical dragon who accidentally stumbled upon the little creature's brood. Sinking its fangs into the soft portions of flesh underneath the dragon's deep red scales, the cobra injected its deadly venom, barely even phasing the dragon. Immediately struck by a wave of agony, the dragon struggled to fly to its mountainous lair to rest. Too proud and stubborn to seek assistance from creatures lower than itself, the dragon laid there, curled in a ball of blood and necrotic flesh before finally passing away.

monster.name: Colláis
languages: understands Common and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Impale and Toss
entries: When the colláis hits a Medium or smaller creature with a gore attack, it can use a bonus action to impale and toss the creature. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage and be flung up to 10 feet away from the colláis in a direction of the collais' choice and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The colláis has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The colláis's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The colláis makes one gore attack and two hooves attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cry of the Forest
entries: The colláis sounds a dreadful and reverberating call. Each creature within 100 feet of the colláis that can hear the cry must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the colláis's Cry of the Forest for the next 24 hours. Forest-dwelling beasts and monstrosities with an Intelligence of 4 or lower automatically succeed or fail on this saving throw, the colláis's choice.

The colláis is a large, deer-like animal covered in thick, black fur. A great rack of antlers grows from its thick skull, in which prominent eye sockets display two red embers for eyes. The creature has no mouth; instead, a coarse beard grows in its place.

entries.name: Summoned Protector
entries: If a forest village is in danger, the villagers might perform a ritual sacrifice to summon a colláis. Once the ritual is complete, the creature appears in the branches of a nearby tree. It then stalks the village and its surroundings. A colláis returns to  the Feywild after 24 hours.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The colossal squid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Jet
entries: While underwater, the colossal squid can take the dash action to jet backward at a speed of 140 feet. It must move in a straight line while using this ability.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The colossal squid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The colossal squid makes eight tentacle attacks and one bite attack. It can substitute two tentacles attacks for one constrict attack if it has a creature {@condition grappled} at the start of its turn, but it never constricts more than once per turn.

action.name: Mangling Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a target that is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage.. If two tentacle attacks hit the same target in one turn, the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Constrict
